meanings.definition: An incorrect quotation attributed to someone.
meanings.sent1: The misquotation in the article caused confusion among the readers.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a misquotation in the book and decided to correct it.
meanings.sent3: The misquotation in the speech made everyone chuckle at the speaker's mistake.
meanings.sent4: His misquotation of the famous line turned the serious moment into a comedy.
meanings.sent5: The misquotation stood out like a bright red flag in the text.

meanings.definition: The act of misquoting someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His misquotation of the facts led to a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent2: The misquotation of historical events can alter our perception of the past.
meanings.sent3: The misquotation during the debate made everyone pause and question the accuracy.
meanings.sent4: Her misquotation of the lyrics turned the song into a hilarious rendition.
meanings.sent5: The misquotation echoed in his mind, reminding him to always double-check.
